name: Rainbow Ice Cream Pops
description: Simply stack your colors in popsicle molds (I used the Orkin mold) or even paper cups, insert a stick, and let them freeze. This recipe couldn't be easier, and the finished product is a pleasurable frozen treat with a visual twist which makes it that much more delightful to eat.

recipeInstructions.text: Spoon equal amounts of the red-hued ice cream into each popsicle mold (about 1/2 heaping tablespoons each). Repeat with orange, yellow, green, blue, and violet ice cream. Each mold should be just filled to the top.

Insert the popsicle sticks in the center of each mold or cup, ensuring that there is approximately a 1/2-inch gap between the end of the stick and bottom of the mold (which will be the top of the popsicle). Place the molds in the freezer for about 2 hours, or until quite firm.
When ready to eat, remove from the molds.
